hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Tha'labah ibn Su'ayr: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Wrap them with their wounds, for no one is wounded in the path of Allah, Mighty and Majestic, except that he will come on the Day of Resurrection with his wound having the color of blood and the fragrance of musk.' Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'I will be the witness for these on the Day of Resurrection.' Then he stood over them and ordered their burial. He did not wash them nor did he pray over them as he prays over the dead, nor did he shroud them in other than their garments. He would command that two men be buried in one grave, and he would say: 'Which of these took more of the Quran?' When they pointed to the one who took more of the Quran, he would place him first in the lahd (burial niche) before his companion.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu al-Shumus al-Balawi, may Allah be pleased with him: I was with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ during the expedition to Tabuk. We found that we had camped at the well of Thamud or the well of Hijr, and we had drawn water and kneaded dough. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ ordered us to pour out the water and discard the dough and to depart. I had prepared a hasah (mixture of dates, butter and dried yogurt) for myself, so I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, shall I feed it to my riding camel?' He said: 'Feed it to her.' So we poured out the water, discarded the dough, and departed until we camped at the well of Salih.

We said: 'Who is Amr, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'Amr ibn al-As.' We said: 'What about him?' He said: 'Whenever I called people to give charity, he would give generously. So I would say: From where do you have this? He would say: From Allah, the Mighty and Majestic. And Amr spoke the truth, and indeed Amr has much good with Allah the Most High.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu al-Ramda: A man drank until he became intoxicated, so the Messenger of Allah ﷺ flogged him. Then he drank until he became intoxicated [Abu Salih said: I don't know if it was the third or fourth time], so he drank until he became intoxicated. He (the Prophet ﷺ) said: 'Strike off his neck (execute him).' And I saw him being carried on a camel. [Abu Bakr ibn Abi Asim said: This is contradicted by the hadith of Uthman ibn Affan from the Prophet ﷺ: 'The blood of a Muslim person is not lawful except in one of three cases...']

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by al-Zuhri: A man from Bali informed me, saying: A charity collector sent by the Prophet ﷺ came to us. The Balawi man said: 'Who sent you?' He said: 'The Messenger of Allah ﷺ.' The Balawi said: 'By Allah, did Allah command him with this?' He said: 'By Allah, Allah commanded him with this' - twice. The Balawi said: 'By Allah, I would not be worthy if I did not give the Messenger of Allah ﷺ the best of my wealth - you shall be given the best of it, two camels.' So he took from him two she-camels of similar age. When he came with them to the Prophet ﷺ, he disapproved of them and said: 'What are these?' He said: 'I took them from a man who said such and such,' describing what was mentioned. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Give them back to the Azd if they come to us.' So he (the Balawi) came to the Prophet ﷺ and pledged allegiance to him. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'No time will pass upon people except that it is better than what comes after it until the Hour is established. And among what he said: If you intend a matter, then you must be deliberate until Allah shows you a way out from it.'
